Description: Conical foot sherd of Chian pottery chalice; interior reserved; exterior, white slip: glazed black (fired red and worn); reserved at edge of foot; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis) (according to Ashmolean Museum register)
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

The height of the foot suggests that it is later than the early Wild Goat Style and patterned chalices. Such conical feet are found through to the mid-6th century BC on Mature Animal Style, Grand Style and Chalice Style chalices.
Bibliographic references: Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 681, no. 402)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 84, no. 61, pl. V.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0700) (phase 2)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
